preqs: Must have passed PTG1025 Painting as an interdisciplinary practice andOHS1000

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {FNA1201, FNA1211, PTG1511, PTG1512, PTG1531, PTG1542, PTG2513, PTG2514, PTG2523, PTG2524, PTG3515, PTG3516}
Must have passed a unit in {OHS1000}

proh: Must not have achieved a pass in any of PTG1511, PTG1512, PTG1531 orPTG1542.
unitName: Painting as an interdisciplinary practice B
description: This unit gives students who are not taking painting as a major study the opportunity to develop the practice and theory of Painting as a means of contemporary creative expression. By providing the means to increase their level of competence within the Painting discipline it forms a sound conceptual and technical basis for an ongoing continuing study in Painting. It also lays the groundwork for developing interdisciplinary approaches and extending the discipline of Painting into wider fields of practice.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
